item.description:
A looping hike of roughly 4 miles and roughly 4 hrs. at Hubbard Park in Meriden, CT. We'll stop at Merimere Resevoir and follow the road to the back, cut over the dam and hike on the rough trail on East Mountain. There will be clifftop views at times. We will make our way to Castle Craig. We will ascend the tower and take in the expansive views. We will then make our way down steep trail for a bit and through the woods back to the reservoir and then back to our cars at the start. Some of the hike will be on a portion of the Metacomet Trail.

We will also tell the Legend of The Black Dog of The Hanging Hills of Meriden!

“If you meet the Black Dog once, it shall be for joy; if twice, it shall be for sorrow; and the third time shall bring death.” – W.H.C. Pynchon

 

Meet at the large parking lot on the east side of Mirror Lake (see map below) and we'll hike from there. Due to the distance and some up/down I would rate this hike high moderate. You must bring a quart or two of water and trail appropriate shoes for rough rocky trail on the second half of the hike. A small backpack would be advised to carry water and maybe a snack so hands are free.

Approximate location/directions (parking lot, Notch Rd., Meriden, CT): http://www.mapquest.com/maps?city=Meriden&state=CT&address=95+Notch+Rd

[Lat.=41.5499, Long.=-72.8321]

Trail map (1st page) & general information: http://www.meridenlandtrust.com/Hubbard_quad.pdf

More information about Hubbard Park: http://www.cityofmeriden.org/Content/Hubbard_Park/

The Legend of The Black Black Dog of The Hanging Hills of Meriden

Decent summary at:
http://cttrips.blogspot.com/2006/01/hanging-hills-of-meriden-legend.html

Original Publication of Connecticut Quarterly, Volume 4, April - June, 1898 (See " The Black Dog" by Harvard Geologist W.H.C. Pynchon, pg. 153 - 161 (physical pages 162 - 170 in PDF file)):
http://books.google.com/books?id=n_8aAAAAYAAJ&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false

=== Legal Stuff ===

By clicking on "Yes" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows: In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
item.how_to_find_us: Leader driving silver Ford Escape SUV, CT plates. Meet at parking lot.

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group

item.name: Hike at Hubbard Park (via East Peak) in Meriden CT
